talk.author: did:plc:yxrvxbjyfjzasf2gpkc7s5mm
talk.utter: Yes, small in total--but a significant issue in some metro areas where the job market is good and corporate relocations are up: Alanta, Charlotte, DFW, Phoenix, Indianapolis... Decent entry-level housing is almost nonexistent for at least a one-hour commuting radius in some of these places.

talk.author: did:plc:yxrvxbjyfjzasf2gpkc7s5mm
talk.utter: Somewhere in the 1980s, the housing market became a massive target for speculative investment--so a big shift away from the post WWII market attuned to middle class expectations for home ownership. I suspect the changes to the tax code and to corporate valuation under Reagan might explain a lot.

talk.author: did:plc:lqfszvq7vmq6nbzqt7y2n36z
talk.utter: It's that we stopped building enough housing

talk.author: did:plc:yxrvxbjyfjzasf2gpkc7s5mm
talk.utter: There is no shortage of high-end housing: what has vanished is entry-level/affordable housing. (see www.axios.com/2023/08/24/n...). I blame the tax codes to some degree, bc it's more profitable for companies to write off vacant/unsold expensive housing than to build and sell affordable homes.

talk.author: did:plc:lqfszvq7vmq6nbzqt7y2n36z
talk.utter: Making it more financially beneficial to write off losses doesn't explain why we didn't build enough houses or why not enough new houses are starter homes

talk.author: did:plc:yxrvxbjyfjzasf2gpkc7s5mm
talk.utter: What I am saying is that building starter homes is not nearly as profitable as building high-end homes--even when there is a glut of high-end homes. Therefore, home construction companies are following the profit--a situation created by the tax code and current corporate valuation practices.

But what if we just built all those houses and then also built more?

Building high end homes instead of starter home makes sense only if there is a limit on how many homes that can be built

talk.author: did:plc:yxrvxbjyfjzasf2gpkc7s5mm
talk.utter: I agree with you--but we live in a world where markets have almost nothing to do with real-world conditions. I think the fact corporate capitalism is allowed to exist at all, and is able to accrue far more power than you or I or the rest of creation is accorded is a profound social evil.
